movies.title: Neo Tokyo
movies.plot: In "Labyrinth labyrinthos", a little girl and her cat find within the old longcase clock in her house a doorway to a strange supernatural world. Is it real or just a figment of her vivid imagination? In "Running Man", the champion of a popular deadly racing championship, where racers usually get themselves or each other killed, takes on the ultimate opponent. A reporter is there to witness the supernatural event. In "Construction Cancellation Order", a man is ordered to shut down robotic construction workers who are building some new facility for the government. Since the robots are all programmed to finish their work no matter what, they refuse to be shut down. A deadly game of cat and mouse begins between the man and the machines. However, the game was rigged from the start.
movies.simplePlot: A trilogy of separate stories. In "Labyrinth labyrinthos", a girl and her cat enter a strange world. In "Running Man", a racer takes on the ultimate opponent. In "Construction Cancellation Order", a man must shut down worker robots.

biography.bio: Hideko Yoshida was born on January 7, 1944 in Ishikawa, Japan. She is an actress, known for The Pillow Book (1996), Neo Tokyo (1987) and By Player (2000).
biography.name: Hideko Yoshida

biography.bio: Masane Tsukayama was born on February 6, 1944 in Okinawa, Japan. He is an actor, known for Steamboy (2004), Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie (1994) and Millennium Actress (2001).
biography.name: Masane Tsukayama

biography.bio: Yû Mizushima was born on January 18, 1956 in Tokyo, Japan as Kenji Noda. He is an actor, known for Creamy merveilleuse Creamy (1983), Beast King GoLion (1981) and Angel (1979).
biography.name: Yû Mizushima

biography.bio: Iemasa Kayumi was born on October 31, 1932 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Ghost in the Shell (1995), Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind (1984) and Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood (2009). He died on September 30, 2014 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Iemasa Kayumi

biography.bio: Jôji Yanami was born on August 30, 1931 in Tokyo Prefecture, Japan as Shigemitsu Shirato. He is an actor, known for Dragon Ball Z (1989), Dragon Ball Z Kai (2009) and Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind (1984).
biography.name: Jôji Yanami

biography.bio: Hiroshi Ôtake was born on March 14, 1932 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Akira (1988), Speed Racer (1967) and Gekisou Sentai Carranger (1996).
biography.name: Hiroshi Ôtake

biography.bio: Banjô Ginga was born on November 12, 1948 in Yamanashi, Japan as Takashi Tanaka. He is known for his work on The Jungle Book: The Adventures of Mowgli (1989), Metal Gear Solid (1998) and Street Fighter II: V (1995).
biography.name: Banjô Ginga

biography.bio: Yûsaku Yara was born on March 15, 1948 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and manager, known for Cowboy Bebop: The Movie (2001), Ultraman 80 (1980) and Tokyo Godfathers (2003).
biography.name: Yûsaku Yara

biography.bio: Kazumi Tanaka was born on August 11, 1951 in Suginami, Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Akira (1988), Vampire Hunter D (1985) and Dragon Ball Z (1989). He died on December 20, 2007 in Tama, Tokyo.
biography.name: Kazumi Tanaka

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Robert Axelrod was born on May 29, 1949 in New York City, New York, USA. He is an actor and writer, known for Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (1993), The Blob (1988) and Akira (1988).
biography.name: Robert Axelrod

biography.bio: Cheryl Chase was born on December 25, 1958 in Manville, New Jersey, USA as Cheryl C. Hudock. She is known for her work on Rugrats (1990), Rugrats in Paris: The Movie (2000) and All Grown Up! (2003).
biography.name: Cheryl Chase

biography.bio: Rafael Ferrer was born on March 23, 1960 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Rafael Francisco Ferrer. He is known for his work on Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (2003), Wrath Unleashed (2004) and Captive (2015). He is married to Ligia Brickus. He was previously married to Heather O'Neill.
biography.name: Rafael Ferrer

biography.bio: Barbara Goodson is a "lifer" in show biz. Truly in love with all aspects of this wild & crazy craft. Was aware of her mimicry skills early on in life when she imitated family members & caught on to the positive attention it gave her & the pleasure & camaraderie it gave to others. She delights in the task of putting her own stamp on a character whether it be dramatic, musical, comedic &/or in film, cartoons, v/o, nightclubs, stage, TV, etc. Stuck in a tiny woman's body has always been her challenge since she's always felt much bigger than her under 5' stature & has been recognized for her powerful vocal range playing many nasty yet amusing "bad ladies" on & off screen. She has no intention of ever retiring...& continues to dream of working with more of the 'heavy weights' & being cast in meaningful, well received & lucrative projects. Believes acting is a blessed career that can move mountains. It's not for sissies & contains a community of (mostly) evolved, concerned humans. She is proud to have had the modicum of success she has achieved & looks forward to more.
biography.name: Barbara Goodson

biography.bio: Steve Kramer was born on December 24, 1950 in San Juan Capistrano, California, USA as Steven Mark Kramer. He is an actor and writer, known for Chronicle (2012), Akira (1988) and End of Days (1999).
biography.name: Steve Kramer

biography.bio: Michael McConnohie was born on July 23, 1951 in Mansfield, Ohio, USA as Michael D. McConnohie. He is an actor and writer, known for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1990), Akira (1988) and Resident Evil: Degeneration (2008).
biography.name: Michael McConnohie

laboratory: Tokyo Laboratory Ltd., Tokyo, Japan (as Tôkyô genzô-sho)
